title: Domaine des Capréoles 2016 Diaclase  (Régnié)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes and with 12 months in wood, this wine is open and rich. A Burgundian character gives it a dense texture and obvious aging potential. With firm tannins as well as great red fruits, the wine will age and should be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Château de Chatelard 2016 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Closely planted 70-year-old vines are behind this richly concentrated wine. Dense tannins and a good structure are allied to the ripe blackberry fruits and acidity. Dark and firm, the wine still needs time. Drink from 2019.

title: Beeslaar 2015 Pinotage (Stellenbosch)
description: From longtime Kanonkop winemaker Abrie Beeslaar comes this stellar expression of the grape. Ripe, full and powerful, it's wrapped in a plush yet firm and well-balanced package that should mature well through 2026. Upfront oaky notes of cocoa, toasted vanilla and cedar should further integrate into the rich plum, cassis and boysenberry fruit with time. Earthy and herbal tones of tree bark, fallen leaves and licorice root dance in the background.

title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Quintus Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A fruity nose opens the way to piquant, tart acidity in this coastal cool-climate wine. Concentrated extracted flavors of pomegranate and Bing cherry dominate, rounded by a grit of texture and cola spice.

title: Birichino 2016 Bechthold Vineyard Old Vines Cinsault (Mokelumne River)
description: This is a fresh, lively and refreshing bottling from old vines, which often offer deep complexity on a lighter frame. Aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, cranberry and wet cement lead into a palate full of crisp red currant, tangy strawberry, and a stunningly rocky minerality. Serve slightly chilled.

title: Black Kite 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a compelling mix of sweeter fruit and dry earth on the nose of this bottling, with strawberry compote and rusty rock aromas along with a vanilla-laced brioche. The palate loses the ripe fruit a bit, instead showing tighter and fresh flavors of black raspberry with anise, white pepper and sagebrush, proving quite sleek and restrained in style.

title: Castagnoli 2014 Terrazze Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: French oak, underbrush, balsamic aromas, coconut and baked plum aromas are front and center on this radiant, structured red. Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, the savory, elegant palate delivers wild cherry, pomegranate, baking spice and a hint of orange zest. Firm, polished tannins and fresh acidity provide age-worthy support and balance. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Cascina Chicco 2011 Ginestra Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Forest floor, dried herb, pressed rose and dark spice aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers black cherry steeped in spirits, licorice and clove set against taut, velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Domaine des Nugues 2016  Fleurie
description: The 45-year-old vines that go into this wine give it just the right amount of concentration without losing sight of the generous fruit. This wine has structure, with firm, dry tannins as well as rich black-cherry and black-plum-skin flavors that are integrating well. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Château Husson 2015 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Savory notes of smoke, dried thyme and nuts lend a dark tone to crisp blackberry and cherry flavors. This wine is concentrated and full on the palate but balanced crisply. The finish wraps up with a pleasant bitter cacao note and firm, tacky tannins.

title: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine de Rochegrés  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: Grown at an estate owned by this Beaune-based producer, this wine is dense and full of black fruits and firm tannins. It is toasty, spicy and ripe, beautifully structured and balanced, and ready to age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Amisfield 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: This is a solidly medium-bodied style bursting with a complex mix of red and black fruits, warm pavement, green herbs and dusting polish. The palate is well-structured and grainy-textured, with a herbal, graphite finish. Drink now–2024.

title: Artezin 2016 Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Saturated with dark, almost jammy fruit flavors, this is an extremely flavorful and nicely dry wine that also has great structure. An intensely dark color leads to blackberry and boysenberry aromas, distinctive blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a rich mouthfeel that is well-laced by fine-grained tannins.
designation: Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown

title: Badia a Coltibuono 2013 Cultus Boni  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, tobacco leaf and a balsamic note come together on this. The firmly structured palate is youthfully austere, showing cranberry, sour cherry, dried sage and clove set against taut, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It will benefit from more cellar time to unwind and develop complexity. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Ried Bürsting Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Chervil and miso savoriness combine with fresh pear and lemon notes on the nose of this wine, which tingles with white pepper. The palate is rounded and soft but remains juicily slender. There is earthy power here and a deep well of rich fruit that sings with its distinct and beautiful phenolic structure. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Fontodi 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this elegantly structured red offers enticing aromas of woodland berry, exotic spice and wild herb. Vibrant and savory, the medium-bodied, youthfully austere palate boasts tart cherry, wild raspberry, clove and licorice supported by bright acidity and taut, refined tannins. It's already tempting but will be even better in a few years. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Fontodi 2014 Filetta di Lamole  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with Sangiovese hailing from high-altitude vineyards, this lithe red offers classic varietal aromas of wild cherry, violet, new leather, tobacco and a slightly balsamic note of camphor. It's radiant—almost ethereal—with red cherry, strawberry, star anise and white pepper. Vibrant acidity and taut, refined tannins offset the savory flavors. Drink 2019–2024.

title: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve Fortissimo Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: Celery salt and lemon pith scents set the tone in this wine. The palate follows suit with generous pear fruit that swirls against a savory backdrop of miso and yeast. Lemon pith frames all of this with freshness. The finish centers on gentle pear fruit.

title: Istine 2014 Levigne Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Spiced plum, pressed violet, exotic spice and saddle leather aromas take center stage. Elegant and structured, the vibrant, assertive palate offers black cherry, tobacco and a hint of licorice while racy acidity and fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's youthfully austere and will benefit from more cellaring. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Château de Bellevue Climat Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: Partly aged in wood, this wine is richly structured, spicy and packed with dense fruits. Blackberry and black-cherry flavors are sustained by generous tannins and the dry core. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2019.
designation: Château de Bellevue Climat Les Charmes

title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)
description: Fresh, primary notes of peach and pear are lifted by lavish orange blossom and honeysuckle perfume. This warming, plush wine is full of vanilla, cream and custard but lemony acidity and delicate spice and smoke tones maintain the finesse.

title: Ken Brown 2014 A Cuvée Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling, which includes 5% Viognier, shows aromas of concentrated black currant syrup, vanilla, nutmeg and a bit of bay leaf on the nose. The palate is extremely flavorful, with tons of licorice, blackberry jam, rosemary and thyme. Vanilla rises on the finish.

title: Lapostolle 2013 Borobo Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: At first, this unique blend of grapes originally from Bordeaux, the Rhône and Burgundy is oaky and toasty, with jammy berry scents and an overriding note of maple. The palate is saturation city, meaning it's full, chewy and oaky. Flavors of wood resin, vanilla and cedar absorb savory plum and cassis notes both before and on a weighty finish. Drink this broad modern wine now.

title: Last Light 2015 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This well-named project comes from a seaside vineyard that may get the last direct sunlight of the entire Central Coast, and the cool-climate aspects thrive. Aromas of dewy sagebrush, shaved pine and myrrh mix with mulberry and underripe raspberry on the nose. The mouthfeel is full while the flavors are tart with tangy cranberry cherry tomato and Kalamata olive, leaving the palate refreshed.

title: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Vieilles Vignes Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: The combination of the famed Côte du Py vineyard and old vines is impressive and rich. This is still a structured, dense wine, very firm and with black, ripe and juicy fruit developing alongside the tannins. The wine will be ready to drink in 2019.

title: Loimer 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Soy-like yeastiness takes turns with ripe, yellow pear scents on the nose of this wine. The palate unites these notions, but the rounded, rich and highly textured mouthfeel wins the day. Some bitter pith appears in the background and makes for a lip-smacking finish.

title: Netzl 2016 Ried Bärnreiser Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)
description: A touch of hazelnut and smoke accompanies the flowing green and yellow apple notes on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a touch of yeasty richness without distorting its svelte translucency in the slightest. The bright green and yellow apple notes are free to swirl against this finely-tuned backdrop. The finish is dry, fresh, yeasty, fruity and long.

title: Pascal Aufranc 2015 Probus  (Juliénas)
description: The Roman emperor Probus is supposed to have brought the Gamay grape to the region, hence the name of this wine. With its rich tannins and generous black fruits, this dense wine is concentrated both with tannins and fruit. It will develop impressively in the months to come. Drink from 2019.

title: Passing Time 2014 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Though not labeled as such, this is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (78%), Merlot (18%) and Cabernet Franc (8%). Coming from top sites Discovery, Quintessence, Seven Hills, The Benches, Figgins, Klipsun and Champoux, there's a lot of sophistication in the aromas, with notes of dried herb, leaf, graphite, anise, spice and cherry providing appeal. The flavors are intense and full, showing an exquisite sense of balance and intensity. It keeps you coming back for more.

title: Richard Rottiers 2016  Brouilly
description: Rich fruit masks the gentle tannins in this opulent wine. Ripe blackberry and juicy black-plum flavors are warm, generous and lightly structured. This full-bodied wine will be ready from mid-2018.
